definition: Tsarist Russia/abbr. for 沙皇俄國|沙皇俄国[Sha1 huang2 E2 guo2]
Russia/Russian/abbr. for 俄羅斯|俄罗斯[E2 luo2 si1]/Taiwan pr. [E4]

sentences.english: Tsarist Russia in 1898, when the railway construction in the Middle East, in this set up Sarthou station.
sentences.chinese: 年沙俄修建中東鐵路時，在此建立了薩爾圖站。

sentences.english: During the 17th and mid19th the Russian territory expanded to The Kurile Islands and Alaska.
sentences.chinese: 19世紀中期，沙俄勢力擴張至千島羣島和阿拉斯加。

sentences.english: He was also assigned the duty of infiltrating the Czarist police.
sentences.chinese: 他又被派去滲透沙俄警局。

sentences.english: When the 8 armies come into China, the Russian army occupied the Kaiping province.
sentences.chinese: 八國聯軍進入中國時，沙俄軍隊佔領了開平煤礦。

definition: the war of 1904-1905 between Russia and Japan
Treaty of Nerchinsk (1698) between Qing China and Russia
the Qing court (as government of China)
Treaty of Aigun, 1858 unequal treaty forced on Qing China by Tsarist Russia
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
